newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore HSFO edging higher, but upside limited.
newsitem.headline: Singapore HSFO edging higher, but upside limited.

text.p: High sulphur fuel oil prices on Wednesday were $1.00 firmer amid mixed sentiment but with the upside seen limited amid good supplies, traders said.
Cst 180 cargoes for loading in October were bid at $114-$115 per tonne, around offer levels seen on Tuesday.
A major and a trader were bidding for centistoke 180 cargoes, traders said.
But while bids outnumbered offers, cash fundamentals remained soft, they said.
Traders said supplies in Singapore have increased as refiners resumed normal production after recent cut backs and South Korean supplies were healthy.
They said the only demand outlet in the region was China.
Chinese fuel oil imports were expected to increase to around 300,000 tonnes in October from around 200,000 tonnes seen for September delivery.
Traders said there was also more supplies heading to Singapore from Fujiarah.
In the swaps market, October paper was discussed a dollar higher at $114.50-$115.50 on crude gains, up from $113.50-$114.50 on Tuesday.
